page.title: 04FARMING IN LAUGHTON
page.content: In Laughton there are several farms. Some are concerned mainly with livestock, whilst others concentrate on growing crops. Here is some information about two farms. On the farm where Miles lives, there are two hundred and fifty acres. The only crop grown is barley. The main concern of the farm is livestock; there are cattle, calves, sheep, pigs and horses. The animals are fed on hay, silage, barley and calf pellets. On Simon's farm there are five hundred and ten acres given over to the rearing of cattle and sheep. When they are ready, the animals are sent to market at either Hailsham or Heathfield. When Simon and Miles grow up, they want to be farmers.
